dict.acceptation: 不；[用以表示否定、否认、拒绝、禁止等]不是；几乎不；未必，没有[用于否定后面的词或短语]；

sent.orig: In conversational English "is not" often contracts to "isn't".
sent.trans: 口头英语中is not常缩写为isn‘t。

sent.orig: She said her future husband would not let her make another film.
sent.trans: 她说她的未婚夫不会让她再拍电影了。（此句用would not let，意思是“阻止”）

sent.orig: If the name is not right then speech will not be in order, and if speech is not in order then nothing will be accomplished.
sent.trans: 名不正则言不顺，言不顺则事不成！

sent.orig: It is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs.
sent.trans: 她不粗俗，不追求私利，不轻易发怒，不追究过失。

sent.orig: "Waste not, want not" is her favourite maxim.
sent.trans: “不浪费则不匮乏”是她喜爱的格言。
